# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(text, text_width::Int = 10)
    output = ""
    for word in split(text)
        if length(word) + length(output) > text_width
            output *= "\n"
        end
        output *= word * " "
    end
    return output[1:end-1] # Remove the trailing space
end
```

Example usage:

```julia
text = "Hello there! This is a very long string that I want to wrap into lines of text. Each line should not exceed 10 characters in width."
wrap_string(text, 10)
# Output:
# Hello there!
# This is a
# very long
# string that
# I want to
# wrap into
# lines of
# text. Each
# line should
# not exceed
# 10 characters
# in width.
```
